attributes.action: insist that the Civil Aviation Authority implement its policy of mandatory transponder equipage of all air conveyances (manned and unmanned) to enhance the safety of other airspace users and the security of the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Transponders enable Air Traffic Controllers to gain information from aircraft by responding to interrogations from the ground infrastructure or from airborne safety systems.

Only mode S transponders identify the aircraft that is responding, providing Controllers with information enabling identification of the individual aircraft, as well as safety-critical information about the aircraft's current altitude (height above sea level).

The ability to uniquely identify every airborne conveyance allows the state to pro-actively monitor alien/unannounced/illegitimate inbound flights to the UK carrying who knows what.

The final safety-net that passenger carrying aircraft have, collision avoidance systems (TCAS), rely on threats to their safety carrying transponders.

For owners of light aircraft, balloons and gliders, fitting a Mode S transponder is a minor additional one-off cost.

We request that the Prime Minister insist the CAA implement this as planned.
